TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CorrelationQuery extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a clause and a clause that identify the unique characteristics of a message so that it can be routed to the correct instance.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A <xref:System.ServiceModel.CorrelationQuery> is a set of queries that are run on an incoming or outgoing message to generate a set of instance keys. An <xref:System.Runtime.DurableInstancing.InstanceKey> represents an association between the data selected from the query and a particular service instance.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.CorrelationQuery.Where%2A> clause allows the user to filter the set of messages that this <xref:System.ServiceModel.CorrelationQuery> runs on. The <xref:System.ServiceModel.CorrelationQuery.Select%2A> clause represents the query set used to uniquely identify the service instance for which an incoming message should be dispatched. The <xref:System.ServiceModel.CorrelationQuery.SelectAdditional%2A> clauses are a set of query sets that represent new instance keys that must be created to associate that data with the service instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.ServiceModel.CorrelationQuery> instances are considered equal if their <xref:System.ServiceModel.CorrelationQuery.Where%2A> clauses are equal.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.ServiceModel.CorrelationQuery.GetHashCode%2A> returns a hash code based on the value of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CorrelationQuery.Where%2A> clause.
